content: nassak nasaq pang hat joel erickson yarn worsted weight 2-4 colours depending on chart used gauge 6 single crochets to the inch hook e 3 5mm this gives approximately a size 7 ¼ 22 keep increasing for a larger size stop increasing sooner for a smaller size in the background colour magic loop 10 stitches or chain 5 join and work 10sc in loop round 1 work 2 single crochets in each stitch around 20 sts round 2 and all even rounds single_crochet in each stitch around round 3 work 1 single_crochet in next stitch then 2 single_crochet in next stitch repeat around 30sts round 5 work 1 single_crochet in each of next 2 stitches then work 2 single_crochet in next stitch repeat around 40sts round 7 work 1 single_crochet in each of next 3 sts then work 2 single_crochet in next stitch repeat around 50sts round 9 work 1 single_crochet in each of next 4 sts then work 2 single_crochet in next stitch repeat around 60 sts continue as established until there are 130 sts if working charts #4 or #6 eliminate 2 of the increases for a total of 128 sts work even until cap covers your ears then turn work place marker and work 2 rounds in the opposite direction work chart pattern of choice work 2 rounds in the background colour cut yarn and pull end through loop to finish off work a round of slip_stitch on the foldline make tassel and cord monk s cord crochet chain braid whatever you prefer and attach to top of hat weave in all ends nassak #6 chart 4 repeats 2 colours this chart requires 128 sts rather than 130 simply omit two of the increases nassak #4 32 repeats 3 colours this chart also requires 128 sts omit 2 increases nassak #5 10 repeats 4 colours
